review: Starting a small art school in our village was daunting. I was worried about the costs, the materials, or even if I have enough time since I have to promote my school. And since I know that this is what I want to do, to inspire children to express themselves through art, I decided to tackle my apprehensions one at a time. The building wasn't a problem since my family owns a commercial space along the main road of our village. I then started looking for suppliers that can accommodate a relatively small order of desks and chairs for children - not too bulky, yet not too small to allow them to freely move. Hisolomon provided just that. The desks and chairs are study - made from wood and steel. The staffs are accommodating and the prices are reasonable. I'm looking at ordering from them again once I exceed my target number of students by 2014.

review: Our short stay here is indeed filled with fun and laughter. My son loves the room where we have this big aquarium with numerous variety of fishes as part of the room's wall. Food selection is also reasonable. Definitely a great place for the whole family! And yes, the hotel staff are very polite and accommodating, it is really a plus!

address: Manila Ocean Park,  Roxas Boulevard, Luneta, City of Manila, Metro Manila
review: If you want a staycation that is out of the ordinary .. Spend a night or maybe a day or two with famiky or friends at the Hotel H2O beside the Manila Ocean Park! We got one of their Marina Superior rooms and it was sooo cool! The interior is simple and modern but what will take your breath away is the installed aquarium walls that gives u a view of some of the amazing sea animals like fishes, sea horses ans jelly fish passing thru your walls as you relax. Truly a wonderful experience

address: Manila Ocean Park,  Roxas Boulevard, Luneta, City of Manila, Metro Manila
review: we stayed here last june just on a whim. no occasion, we just wanted to relax. We were upgraded to a family suite. my teen son absolutely loved it. the room was very very spacious. we had a room and a separate living area. my son slept at the sleeping area coz he felt he had a room all to himself, with its own tv. The bathroom seems to be hazardous for small children since there was no door to just lock it. We had a jacuzzi, a separate shower and toilet areas. overall, it was really a relaxing stay. my only problem is that outside the hotel, it feels a bit crowded due to ocean park. it seems off to go the restaurant to have breakfast without dressing up, or to go to the pool since it feels a bit public. during the night, it was an eerie walk to the hotel lobby since you have to walk the expanse of a deserted ocean park.

address: Manila Ocean Park,  Roxas Boulevard, Luneta, City of Manila, Metro Manila
review: Are you looking for a unique place/room to stay at? Try H2O Hotel. Their rooms are big, good family of 4 and is indeed spacious, clean, organized and fresh smelling. PLUS PLUS PLUS... is their wall to wall aquarium is so nice and is very amazing! It's like you are sleeping under water. prices are also reasonable.

review: I like the aquarium-themed of the hotel. Very unique. :)

review: we stayed here for their easter sunday egg hunt for my son.. which we did not participate in because my son was just about 18mons. we got their Aqua Classic Room Promo and paid about Php 8000 for Rm 3140. this was a big aqua room where we had wall to wall aquarium that made my son happiest. the room was tastefully furnished & huge. we had a king sized bed with clean white sheets & a sofa bed. this room is great for a family of 4. our room had a small round table with 2 modern chairs, a 40inch flat screen tv to the delight of my boys & a business/ writing desk. their bathroom was spacious & it featured a rainshower head they also offered free wifi. the breakfast buffet was superb, this was served at the makansutra. they  had filipino breakfast fare, chinese dimsums & continental breakfast food. we also enjoyed their swimming pool but getting there was quite a task as this was near the hotel entrance. the staff was helpful & pleasant, checking & out was a breeze. but thinking back no one carried our overnight bags to the lobby downstairs but we were assisted when we reached their lobby. I would definitely go back & book the bayview room next because my son loves the ocean.

address: A. Arnaiz Avenue corner EDSA, Ayala Center, Makati City, Metro Manila
review: Intriguing is the Sunday crossover buffet of the Dusit.  You register at the lobby and are given a tag then you are free to roam the hotel restaurants and get from any of the buffets available.  I find prepaying for a meal at a hotel a bit tacky but I suppose this is unavoidable since you are literally roaming the ground and mezzanine floor restaurants.  The restaurants are Thai, Continental, Italian and Japanese with the usual hotel buffet level food in terms of taste and quality.  two restaurants are in the ground floor and two on the mezzanine so you are literally climbing up and down stairs to get food.  Seating depends on which restaurant has an available table, whatever happens you will be going from restaurant to restaurant to get your pick of food.

address: A. Arnaiz Avenue corner EDSA, Ayala Center, Makati City, Metro Manila
review: Its the Dusit way of competing with the larger buffets of hotels such as Sofitel and the Makati Shang.  The experience is not bad and should be experienced by everyone at least once.

review: we stayed here to welcome the new year 2013. check in was a breeze even if there were a lot of people, the staff were polite, pleasant & accommodating. our room was great, the size was standard but the amenities were excellent. we had the bay view & the glorious sunset was ours. we had floor to ceiling windows that showcased our famous sunset. i just love their bed & their pillows, i forgot to ask what pillows they had during our stay. but we didn't have the welcome fruits unlike in my mom's room, they gave us welcome chocolates & bed time chocolates which is a tradition in this hotel. i also love their bathroom that had a separate shower enclosure & bath tub.. the bathroom also had a small flat screen tv which is placed facing the loo.. guess you can watch tv while doing your thing there.. the tv was right above the tub i had a hard time watching while i was soaking in the tub. the swimming pool was great. my 2yo son enjoyed the wading pool so much that he didn't want to leave. we also enjoyed their breakfast, they mostly had Asian fare & breads with different kinds of cheeses & various desserts.. =) overall our stay here was great & i wish we could come back for more! =)

We actually spend our Christmas party hear last year and we are also planning to spend it here this coming year again. Their fine dining was great and classy. And the good thing is everything inside the refrigerator in our room is free! The design of the room is a bit weird, but it turns out to be relaxing. When we also checked in, one request, they check, and it's granted! No extra charge! Thank you! We're happy with our stay. Compared to all hotels we've been in Alabang. I would definitely go back and stay at this hotel again!

We checked in pretty early and though check in time is supposedly 2pm, they accommodated us, put us into our room, gave us welcome leis and refreshments. The compound was massive with saltwater and freshwater pools/lagoons, lots of cafes/restos to choose from, there were free bikes and kayak rides and wall climbing and archery. There was a firing range, though the ammo cost an arm and a leg so we passed on that. Our package includes a 1 hour full-body massage and aromatherapy bath which was delightful. I'd really recommend this place for couples and families.

Great South African, Australian, and Argentinian varietals too at reasonable prices. In the House Specials, a great Chilean Seabass in a miso-mirin sauce and Lamb Ribs in a light mint sauce and of course the old reliable Casa Specials from Salpicado, Lengua, Callos and of course the best Caesar Salad.

review: Mexican cuisine is finally making a comeback in the Metro. Ristras, just like Orale, is turo-turo or cafeteria, rather than Cantina-style. Semi DIY, they'll assist you as you choose what to combine with your basic menu choice: choose a burrito, and you have beans choices, meats, and veggies. Meats range from carnitas or pulled pork, roast beef, lengua, chicken, etc. Mexican cantina food is fragrant and quite healthy, so this is now my go-to when I don't want to fuss. They're dynamite (a pepper filled cheese flauta) is the chief disappointment. Which is too bad considering it'd be great with beer. And they lack Mexican beer choices, unlike Orale.
